turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lawrence Watt-Evans.
turn.1: What was the serialization of Ethshar?
turn.2: In April 2005, Watt-Evans announced that the first draft of his latest Ethshar novel, "The Spriggan Mirror", would be made available online as a serial, using a modified version of the Street Performer Protocol.
turn.4: The draft has since been finished and was previously available in its entirety on one of Watt-Evans' websites.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: However, a revised version has now been published commercially in both electronic and paper editions, so the free version has been removed.
turn.8: He has since completed several online serials, all using that same method: "The Vondish Ambassador" in 2007, "Realms of Light" started November 2008 (his only non-Ethshar serial, a sequel to "Nightside City"), "The Final Calling" started in June 2010 (later published as "The Unwelcome Warlock").
turn.9: Did he write any other novels?
turn.10: In April–July 2012 he did a 5th serial, "The Sorcerer's Widow".
turn.11: What other novels did he write?
turn.12: In June 2013 Watt-Evans began a crowd-funding campaign for his unpublished science fiction novel "Vika's Avenger", a story unrelated to his previous works, and in July he started a 6th Ethshar serial, "Ishta's Companion".
